ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Items in Chat
ygData.msgSnippet: ... From: Techpriest  To: EverQuest (E-mail)  Sent: Monday, December 29, 2003 4:11 PM Subject:
ygData.messageBody:
----- Original Message -----
From: "Techpriest" <techpriest@...>
To: "EverQuest (E-mail)" <EverQuest@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Monday, December 29, 2003 4:11 PM
Subject: [EverQuest] Items in Chat


> Did a lot of searching the web and learned a lot more about EQ. I can
play
> CDs with my hot keys now and my social hot keys include the targets
name.
> One thing I have not been able to find, is how people put items in
their
> messages so you can click on them to see the specs. Like when
somebody says
> "WTS a Sword." and the word Sword is in a different color and when you
click
> on it you see the stats.

In this case, assuming you had an item called 'Sword' you would type
"WTS a" then press ALT and click on the item in question in your
inventory. This brings up a window with the items details. Click on the
picture of the item in that window and its item name will be pasted to
your chat cursor as a hotlink. Your chat bar would now say "WTS a Sword"
with Sword highlighted and a hotlink

Matt.
